intro: Cercestis hepperi, commonly known as the Hepper's orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique and striking floral structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cercestis hepperi is considered a rare and endangered species.
